messages.content:
Ahh ok, I understand. visibility probably also helps normalise talking about dv, especially important for anyone going through that who feels fear/shame about it. Honestly dv can happen to anyone. 

You guys got friends and/or family over there? 

How are the other ferrals going? Howâs Chev? She just randomly popped into my brain today. Look forward you guys coming back so we can have an irl catch up. X (edited)

Ahh ok, I understand. visibility probably also helps normalise talking about dv, especially important for anyone going through that who feels fear/shame about it. Honestly dv can happen to anyone. You guys got friends and/or family over there? 

How are the other ferrals going? Howâs Chev? She just randomly popped into my brain today. Look forward you guys coming back so we can have an irl catch up. X
Hahahah yes that is where we used to get trashed as teenagers!!! We had so many fun times there!

Dude thatâs so cool! And what a legend to open up her own club! So fucked up that Aboriginal people had to have a special pass to be able to be in certain areas and out at certain times. Iâd like to think weâve come so far, but the amount of racists this country still has is shit. I felt so sad when the referendum was voted no. 

Hope youâre feeling better now dude! 

Thank you so much â¤ï¸. I am allowed to tell people about it as Ryf is open about this stuff, Esp if it raises awareness. But it was all types of dv and coercive control. Physical, mental, sexual, financial abuse. Thankfully we have a good relationship and I learnt about it. She cut off all ties when she was pregnant so they know nothing about the baby. But then there were some incidents after he was born that made Ryf feel even more unsafe. Will fill you in when I do see you. But basically he ex is a bad person. Which is why we have kept it a secret about us moving away.
Quinnâs beach front on the Bell Tower today. This is where we used to partaay, isnât it? ð¤ª (edited)
Quinnâs beach front on the Bell Tower today. This is where we used to partaay, isnât it?

Hey so sorry to hear about Ryfâs situo. That sounds really scary. I wonât ask too many questions cos thatâs personal to her,I guess. I just hope you guys are ok wherever you are. Let me know if I can do anything to help. â¤ï¸âð©¹ (edited)

Cool! Hope itâs as good as I remember. When I read it I was living in a share house not far from where part of it was set AND I was living with the first aboriginal veterinary surgeon in WA, I think. Her nanna was Helena Murphy (nee Clarke) who was an aboriginal activist in the days when if you wanted to go into the city centre you had to get a yellow card. She was offered one probably because she was cool but she told the authorities to get fucked cos it meant sheâd have to distance herself from her family. She went on to to open the Coolbaroo Club which was like a jazz club for aboriginal and white people after the Second World War - even Nat King Cole played there! 

Oi I just started reading your big message WTF! Iâll write back properly to that in a sec. 

I have a bit of a lurgy and was being lazy thinking Iâd write back later and hadnât read it. Rude. ð¬ (edited)

Look what I just found at an op shop!

Hahaha sounds like a lot of older generation folk. Man could you imagine the uproar from all the racists posâs if we had an aboriginal pm. If there were more female pms and presidents I doubt the world would be the shitshow it is now! 

Ahahaha thatâs so funny, tbf I donât actually remember it. Iâll put it on my to read list though! 

Miss you too dude. Bubs is almost 10 months old which is crazy! 

This is on the low down as only a handful of people know, but we donât actually live in Perth anymore. We had to move interstate as Ryf was in a really bad dv relationship (hence the secrecy). Iâm hoping to come visit sometime before the end of the year, when I do Iâll hit you up and we can hang xxx

To be fair my nan also has unhelpful commentary about queers, millennial snowflakes, grandchildren that annoy her and a lot of other people but when she saw Mechelle Turvey on the news she could not stop talking about her. Haha. Itâs hard to convert Nan. Mechelle is a pretty powerful speaker. She should be PM Idk. 

 Ahh Iâd like to read that book. I had my kinda dumb aha moment when I read Sally Morganâs, My Place. I was going around telling everyone that it should be taught in high school because it feels so important. Apparently it WAS taught in high school, I just didnât finish high school. ð¤ª


Anyways, miss you guys hope the baby is going well and you guys too! Xx (edited)

Wow thatâs amazing your racist nan was converted! Absolutely heartbreaking right. Iâm currently reading âGrowing up Aboriginalâ and fuck itâs devastating the amount of racism aimed towards aboriginal people.
Ahh man, this was so sad. I read some of his friendâs testimonials and cried. The stuff his mum said about the whole thing was so powerful too even my racist Nan was converted. ð­
